sen.j: 開業当時は出町橋から三宅八幡宮と大原村へ運行していたが、年々路線を拡張して一時は洛北におけるバス交通を独占した。
sen.e: Although the company operated bus routes from Demachi-bashi Station to Miyake-Hachimangu Shrine and Ohara-mura during the initial period, it expanded its bus route network year by year and once dominated the bus service business in Rakuhoku area.

sen.j: しかし1925年、京都電燈（株）（後の京福電気鉄道）直営の（旧）叡山電鉄、1928年傍系の鞍馬電鉄（株）（現・叡山電鉄叡山電鉄鞍馬線）の開通により両者間の競合が激しくなって営業成績が次第に不振となった。
sen.e: However, (old) Eizan-Dentetsu, which was directly managed by Kyoto Dento (Keifuku Electric Railroad Co., Ltd.) and Kurama Dentetsu (the Kurama Line of Eizan Electric Railway), which was also effectively managed by Kyoto Dento, commenced operation in 1925 and 1928 respectively and the company's business results declined due to fierce competition among these companies.

However, (the old) Eizan Electric Railway, which was directly managed by Kyoto Dento, an electric power company (later Keifuku Electric Railroad Co., Ltd.) and Kurama Electric Railway (the present Kurama Line of Eizan Electric Railway), which was also effectively managed by Kyoto Dento, commenced operations in 1925 and 1928, respectively, and the company's business results declined due to fierce competition among those companies.
sen.cmt: Kyoto Dento →Kyoto Dento, an electric power company, Eizan Dentetsu→Eizan Electric Railway, Kurama Dentetsu→Kurama Electric Railway と変更しました。

sen.j: このため、鞍馬電鉄との間に猛烈な乗客争奪合戦を繰り広げたが、これが諸般の弊害を生じる結果となり、1930年に鞍馬電鉄に買収され、京都電燈（株）の傍系会社となった。
sen.e: Under such circumstances, the company sparked a battle with Kurama Dentetsu in order to get passengers, but such battle caused various adverse effects and ultimately, the company was acquired by Kurama Dentetsu in 1930 and came under the effective control of Kyoto Dento.

sen.e: Under such circumstances, the company sparked a battle with Kurama Dentetsu in order to win more passengers, but the battle caused various adverse effects; ultimately, the company was acquired by Kurama Dentetsu in 1930 and effectively came under the control of Kyoto Dento.

sen.j: 1933年には京都市電北大路橋電停を起点として雲ヶ畑に至る雲ヶ畑バス（株）も合併し、洛北を走る交通機関の調整を見るに至った。
sen.e: In 1933, the company acquired Kumogahata Bus, which operated the route from Kitaoji-bashi Stop of Kyoto City Trams to Kumogahata, and public transport that runs in Rakuhoku area finally stabilized.

sen.j: なお、現在も社章として使われている羽うちわのマークは元々は鞍馬電鉄のものであったものが引き継がれている。
sen.e: Current company emblem, a feathered round fan, is the one that was used by Kurama Dentetsu.

sen.j: 一方の嵐山方面は嵐山自動車商会が創業し、京都市内の千本通丸太町通から太秦経由・嵐山渡月橋に至る営業路線を運行してきたが、次第に京都電燈直営の嵐山電鉄との競合による弊害が生じはじめ、おなじく京都電燈が買収することになり、1938年、嵐山バス（株）が設立された。
sen.e: In Arashiyama area, Arashiyama Jidosha Shokai started its business and operated the route from Senbon-dori Marutamachi-dori to Arashiyama Togetsu-kyo Bridge via Uzumasa, but due to adverse effects caused by the competition with Arashiyama Dentetsu, which was under direct control of Kyoto Dento, it was also acquired by Kyoto Dento and Arashiyama Bus Co. Ltd. was established in 1938.

In the Arashiyama area, Arashiyama Jidosha Shokai started business and operated the route from Senbon-dori Marutamachi-dori to Arashiyama Togetsu-kyo Bridge via Uzumasa, but due to the adverse effects caused by the competition with Arashiyama Dentetsu, which was under the direct control of Kyoto Dento, it was also acquired by Kyoto Dento and, in 1938, Arashiyama Bus Co., Ltd., was established.

sen.cmt: Arashiyama Dentetsu →Arashiyama Electric Railwayとしました。

sen.j: その後、満州事変・第二次世界大戦と戦局は次第に深刻な様相を見せはじめ、統制経済の一環として1941年「配電統制令」が施行され、京都電燈は、発送電部門を日本発送電（株）に、配電部門を関西電力（株）・北陸電力（株）にそれぞれ出資し、1942年4月をもって解散した。
sen.e: Under the aggravating war situation during wars like Manchurian Incident and World War Ⅱ, "Ordinance for Electricity Distribution Control" came into force in 1941 as part of economic control measures and Kyoto Dento dissolved in April of 1942 after assigning the electric generation and transmission division to Japan Electric Generation and Transmission Company Co. Ltd. and the electric distribution division to Kansai Electric Power Co., Inc. and Hokuriku Electric Power Company Co.Ltd.
sen.cmt: 「にそれぞれ出資し」 とありますが、出資して解散するということはあり得ませんので、「譲渡して」と解釈して翻訳しております。

sen.j: 残る電鉄部門は同年京福電気鉄道（株）として新発足し、越前、嵐山、叡山の3電鉄を直営し、傍系には三国芦原電鉄、京福電気鉄道永平寺線、京福電気鉄道丸岡線、愛宕山鉄道、鞍馬電鉄および系列のバス事業などを擁していた。
sen.e: The remaining division, the railway division, became independent as Keifuku Electric Railroad Co., Ltd., and it directly managed 3 electric railway companies, Echizen, Arashiyama and Eizan and indirectly managed Mikuni Awara Dentetsu, the Eiheiji Line of Keifuku Electric Railroad Co., Ltd., the Maruoka Line of Keifuku Electric Railroad Co., Ltd., Atagoyama Tetsudo, Kurama Dentetsu and their affiliated bus business.

The remaining (railway) division became independent as Keifuku Electric Railroad Co., Ltd., and it directly managed three electric railway companies (Echizen, Arashiyama and Eizan) and indirectly managed Mikuni Awara Dentetsu, the Eiheiji Line of Keifuku Electric Railroad Co., Ltd., the Maruoka Line of Keifuku Electric Railroad Co., Ltd., Atagoyama Tetsudo, Kurama Dentetsu as well as their affiliated bus businesses.

sen.cmt: Atagoyama Dentetsu →Atagoyama Electric Railway としました。

sen.j: 当時はまだ戦時中の自動車用ガソリン配給停止が続いており、いわゆる代用品時代で木炭車や電気自動車が代燃車として運行されていたが、いずれもガソリン車に比べて著しく力が劣っており、木炭車主体の鞍馬自動車は鞍馬以北の路線を停止してどうにか営業を続けていた。
sen.e: As the allocation of gasoline to cars was suspended during war period, so-called substitution era, charcoal cars and electric cars were used in place of gasoline cars, but their horse power was substantially inferior to that of gasoline cars and Kumara Jidosha, which relied mainly on charcoal cars, barely continued its business while suspending the operation of the route of Kurama northward.

As the allocation of gasoline for use in cars was suspended during the war period, that being the so-called substitution era, charcoal-fueled cars and electric cars were used in place of gasoline cars, but their horsepower was substantially inferior to that of gasoline cars and Kumara Jidosha, which relied mainly on charcoal cars, barely continued its business while suspending the operation of the route for Kurama northward.

As the allocation of gasoline for use in cars was suspended during the war period, that being the so-called substitution era, charcoal-fueled cars and electric cars were used in place of gasoline cars, but their horsepower was substantially inferior to that of gasoline cars and Kumara Jidosha, which relied mainly on charcoal cars, barely continued its business while suspending the operation of the route for Kurama northward.

sen.j: 電気自動車を主力としていた嵐山バスは蓄電能力の関係から全線運行不可能の事態に追い込まれ、両者とも独立しての運行には幾多の障害が生じてきた。
sen.e: Arashiyama Bus, which mainly used electric cars, was also forced to cease the operation of all routes because of the limit of batteries' ability and both companies faced with the difficulty in doing business as an independent company.

Arashiyama Bus, which mainly used electric cars, was also forced to cease the operation of all routes due to the limited battery capability, and both companies faced the challenge of doing business as independent entities.

sen.j: そこで抜本的対策として京福電鉄全額出資による京都バス（株）が1948年に誕生した。
sen.e: Under such circumstances, Kyoto Bus Co. Ltd., which was a wholly owned subsidiary of Keifuku Electric Railroad Co., Ltd., was established in 1948 as a radical measure to cope with such situation.

tit.e: After the establishment of Kyoto Bus
After the establishment of Kyoto Bus
After the establishment of Kyoto Bus

sen.j: 京都バス（株）は合併前の両社からそれぞれ洛北・洛西の郊外バスとしての性格を受けついで発足し、事業規模も従業員27人、車両数14台という小規模な企業体であったが、戦後資材・燃料などの事情も好転してきたのに伴い、合併前に休止していた路線も徐々に復活していった。
sen.e: Kyoto Bus started its business as a relatively small-sized company, with 27 employees and 14 cars, which inherited from former 2 companies the nature of suburban bus company in Rakihoku・Rakusai area, but after the war, it gradually resumed the operation of the routes that had been suspended until the merger thanks to the improvement of the situation surrounding the supply of materials and fuels.

Kyoto Bus started its business as a relatively small company of 27 employees and 14 cars, having inherited from the former two companies the nature of a suburban bus company in the Rakihoku・Rakusai area; however, after the war it gradually resumed the operation of the routes that had been suspended until the merger, thanks to the improvement of the situation surrounding the supplies of materials and fuels.

Kyoto Bus started its business as a relatively small company of 27 employees and 14 cars, having inherited from the former two companies the nature of a suburban bus company in the Rakuhoku and Rakusai areas; however, after the war it gradually resumed the operation of the routes that had been suspended until the merger, thanks to the improvement of the situation surrounding the supplies of materials and fuels.

sen.j: 戦前より旧京都市内の交通は主として市交通局の市電・市バスが担当し、郊外路線は民間バス会社が受け持つといった形態で運行されており、利用客からは乗り換え無しに直通できる運行を希望する声が高かったので、発足当初からの課題は企業規模の拡大と市内部への進出、特に主要ターミナルへの乗り入れ実現にあった。
sen.e: The biggest task for the company since its inauguration was to expand its company size and to make inroads into the area inside of the city, especially to principal terminals, because from pre-war period, private bus companies had operated basically in suburban area while City Tram・City Bus operated by City Transportation Bureau had dominated the area inside of the city and as a result, the company faced with a strong request from its passengers to run buses by which they can go to city center without transfer.

The company's biggest tasks, subsequent to its inauguration, were to expand and make inroads into the area within the city--especially to the principal terminals--because since the pre-war period private bus companies had operated basically in the suburban area while City Tram・City Bus (operated by the City Transportation Bureau) had dominated the area within the city; as a result, the company faced a strong request from its passengers to run buses by which they could reach the city center without having to transfer.

The company's biggest tasks, subsequent to its inauguration, were to expand and make inroads into the area within the city--especially to the principal terminals--because since the pre-war period private bus companies had operated basically in the suburban area while City Tram and City Bus (operated by the City Transportation Bureau) had dominated the area within the city; as a result, the company faced a strong request from its passengers to run buses by which they could reach the city center without having to transfer.

sen.j: そこで行政官庁や関係各機関に働きかけ続けた結果、京都市との共同運行協定を締結し、1950年に雲ヶ畑・上黒田・大原・途中の各線が三条京阪まで乗り入れ、続いて1952年に大原・途中の各線は四条通大宮通まで乗り入れた。
sen.e: As a result of the negotiation with administrative agencies and other relevant institutions, the company concluded Joint Operation Agreement between Kyoto City and based on this Agreement, the routes of Kumogahata ・Kamikuroda ・ Ohara ・ Tochu were extended to Sanjo-Keihan in 1950 and the routes of Ohara ・ Tochu were farther extended to Shijo-dori Omiya-dori in 1952.

As a result of the negotiation with administrative agencies and other relevant institutions, the company concluded a joint-operation agreement with Kyoto City, and based on that agreement the routes of Kumogahata, Kamikuroda, Ohara and Tochu were extended to Sanjo-Keihan in 1950 and the routes of Ohara and Tochu were further extended to Shijo-dori Omiya-dori in 1952.

sen.j: 1953年には嵐山方面から三条京阪、雲ヶ畑・上黒田の各線も四条大宮まで乗り入れ、翌年には嵐山方面から京都駅までの乗り入れが実現した。
sen.e: In 1953, direct bus service from Arasiyama to Sanjo-Keihan as well as the extension of Kumogahata ・Kamikuroda lines to Shijo-Omiya were allowed and in the following year, direct bus service from Arasiyama to Kyoto Station was realized.

In 1953, direct bus service from Arashiyama to Sanjo-Keihan as well as the extension of the Kumogahata and Kamikuroda lines to Shijo-Omiya were allowed, and in the following year direct bus service from Arashiyama to Kyoto Station was realized.
sen.cmt: ・→カンマ及びand としました。

sen.j: これにより市中心部への進出は達成されて利用客にとっての不満も解消したかに見えたが、相互乗り入れは実現したものの、既存路線から乗り入れ可能となった路線の停留所での乗り降りについて、「降車はできるが乗車できない」、逆に都心部から郊外へ向けては「乗車は自由だが降車は禁止」という、いわゆる「クローズドドアシステム」の制約を受けていた。
sen.e: Although it seemed that the company achieved its objective of making inroads into the city center and passengers' dissatisfaction was resolved thanks to the above Agreement, the company's operation was still restricted by so-called "closed door system" under which "passengers can get off but are not allowed to get on" at the bus stops of newly extended routes while "passengers going from city center to suburbs can get on but are not allowed to get off "at these bus stops.

Although it seemed that the company had achieved its objective of making inroads into the city center and passengers' dissatisfaction was resolved thanks to the aforementioned agreement, the company's operations were still restricted by the so-called "closed door system" under which "passengers could get off but weren't allowed to get on" at the bus stops of newly extended routes while "passengers going from the city center to the suburbs could get on but weren't allowed to get off " at those bus stops.

Although it seemed that the company had achieved its objective of making inroads into the city center and passengers' dissatisfaction was resolved thanks to the aforementioned agreement, the company's operations were still restricted by the so-called 'closed door system' under which 'passengers could get off but weren't allowed to get on' at the bus stops of newly extended routes while 'passengers going from the city center to the suburbs could get on but weren't allowed to get off ' at those bus stops.

sen.j: その後、旅客数の増加や路線の拡充延長が進むにつれて、この制約が運営面に及ぼす影響は一層強まり、完全なオープンド・ドア制の確立を目指して京都市と交渉を続けた結果、1972年に市交通局との間に待望のクローズド・ドア制撤廃に関する覚書を交換する運びとなり、永年の懸念であったオープンド・ドア制への移行がようやく実現した。
sen.e: However, as the effects of the above restrictions on the company's operation became serious with the increase of the number of passengers and bus routes, the company continued negotiations with Kyoto City and finally in 1972, long-awaited open door system was realized when the company concluded the note concerning the abolishment of closed door system with City Transportation Bureau.

However, as the effects of the above restrictions on the company's operation became serious with the increased numbers of passengers and bus routes, the company continued negotiations with Kyoto City; finally, in 1972, a long-awaited open door system was realized when the company concluded an agreement with the City Transportation Bureau concerning the abolishment of the closed-door system.

However, as the effects of the above restrictions on the company's operation became serious with the increased numbers of passengers and bus routes, the company continued negotiations with Kyoto City; finally, in 1972, a long-awaited open door system was realized when the company concluded an agreement with the City Transportation Bureau concerning the abolishment of the closed-door system.

sen.j: 1949年ごろから好転し始めた石油事情は代燃車からガソリン車への転換を可能とし、全国的に観光バス部門開設の申請が相次いたが、京都バスも1950年、新規免許申請に踏み切り、11月に一般貸切旅客自動車運送事業を営業開始した。
sen.e: As the transfer from substitute fuel cars to gasoline cars became possible since 1949 thanks to the improvement of oil supply, many companies across the country applied for the license of sight-seeing bus operator and in 1950, Kyoto Bus also applied for the license and commenced general reserved passengers bus business.

As the transfer from substitute-fuel cars to gasoline cars had become possible since 1949 thanks to the improved oil supply, many companies across the country applied for licenses as sightseeing bus operators; in 1950, Kyoto Bus also applied for a license and introduced its general reserve passenger bus business.

As the transfer from substitute-fuel cars to gasoline cars had become possible since 1949 thanks to the improved oil supply, many companies across the country applied for licenses as sightseeing bus operators; in 1950, Kyoto Bus also applied for a license and introduced its general reserve passenger bus business in November of that year.

tit.j: 京都バスを囲む厳しい状況
tit.e: Severe environment surrouding Kyoto Bus Co.,Ltd.
The severe environment surrounding Kyoto Bus Co., Ltd.
The severe environment surrounding Kyoto Bus Co., Ltd.

sen.j: 観光受け入れ都市としては国内随一である京都だが、市内から他地方へ観光旅行へ出かける人員には限度があり、また観光シーズンとシーズンオフの変動の激しさや、他府県からの直通観光バスやマイカーの流入、市内よりのマイカーによる流出など運営に関する諸種の障害があらわれはじめ、稼働率の低下や収益率の伸び悩みが経営を圧迫して貸切部門の存続を許容しがたくなった。
sen.e: The operation of reserved bus business became difficult to continue due to low operation rates and profitability caused by various obstacles such as limited number of citizens visiting other regions, though the number of tourists visiting Kyoto is the biggest in Japan, big fluctuation between tourist season and off-season, inflow of tourist buses and private cars from other prefectures and outflow of people using private cars from the city.

The operation of the reserve bus business became difficult to continue due to the low operation rates and profitability caused by obstacles such as the limited numbers of people visiting other regions, despite Kyoto's reputation as Japan's largest tourist destination; the considerable fluctuation between the tourist season and the off-season; the inflow of tourist buses and private cars from other prefectures; and the outflow of people from the city using private cars.

The operation of the reserve bus business became difficult to continue due to the low operation rates and profitability caused by obstacles such as the limited numbers of people visiting other regions, despite Kyoto's reputation as Japan's largest tourist destination; the considerable fluctuation between the tourist season and the off-season; the inflow of tourist buses and private cars from other prefectures; and the outflow of people from the city using private cars.

sen.j: このため1968年、東京に本社がある国際自動車（株）との間に営業譲渡契約を締結し、18年間に渡って営業を続けてきた貸切部門を廃止した。
sen.e: In 1968, therefore, the company concluded Business Assignment Agreement with Kokusai Mortorcars Co., Ltd., whose head office is located in Tokyo, and abolished reserved bus division which the company had been operating for 18 years.

Consequently, in 1968 the company concluded a business-assignment agreement with Kokusai Motorcars Co., Ltd., whose head office was located in Tokyo, and abolished the reserve bus division that the company had operated for the past 18 years.

Consequently, in 1968 the company concluded a business-assignment agreement with Kokusai Motorcars Co., Ltd., whose head office was located in Tokyo, and abolished the reserve bus division that the company had operated for the past 18 years.

sen.j: その後、時を経て貸切事業へ再進出することとなり、2001年に大型貸切旅客自動車運送事業免許を取得し、この免許を生かして契約輸送も開始し、2001年からのマイクロバスによる京都産業大学の二軒茶屋駅 (京都府)シャトルバスを皮切りに、同8月からの川島織物セルコン（株）の社員輸送、同12月からのイズミヤ（カナート洛北）など、シャトルバス運行を開始した。
sen.e: After years, the company restarted reserved bus business with obtaining the license for large-sized reserved passengers bus operator in 2001 and began contract transport service by providing shuttle bus service, with the use of microbuses, between Kyoto Sangyo University and Niken-chaya Station (Kyoto Prefecture), followed by employees transport for Kawashima Selkon Textiles Co., Ltd. in August of the same year and that for Izumiya (Qanat Rakuhoku) in December of the same year.

Years later, in 2001, the company restarted the reserve bus business by obtaining a license as a large reserve passenger bus operator and began contract transport service by providing shuttle bus service, with the use of microbuses, between Kyoto Sangyo University and Niken-chaya Station (Kyoto Prefecture), followed by employee transport for Kawashima Selkon Textiles Co., Ltd., in August of the same year and that for Izumiya (Qanat Rakuhoku) in December.

Years later, in 2001, the company restarted the reserve bus business by obtaining a license as a large reserve passenger bus operator and began contract transport service by providing shuttle bus service, with the use of microbuses, between Kyoto Sangyo University and Nikenchaya Station (Kyoto Prefecture) in 2001, followed by employee transport for Kawashima Selkon Textiles Co., Ltd., in August of the same year and that for Izumiya (Qanat Rakuhoku) in December.

sen.j: また、2003年には34年ぶりに大型貸切車が導入、2005年にはフルサイズ（12mクラス）のハイデッカー観光車が導入された。
sen.e: In 2003, the company introduced large-sized reserved buses after 34 years and in 2005, it introduced full-sized (12m) high-deck sight-seeing buses.
In 2003, the company introduced large reserve buses after 34 years in business, and in 2005 it introduced full-size (12m) high-deck sightseeing buses.
In 2003, the company introduced large reserve buses after 34 years in business, and in 2005 it introduced full-size (12m) high-deck sightseeing buses.

sen.j: 一方、近年の全国的なモータリゼーションの波は、京都市においても自家用車、ミニバイク、自転車などの激増をもたらし、1981年の京都市営地下鉄京都市営地下鉄烏丸線開業など旅客の交通手段が多様化し、乗客のバス離れ現象が顕著になってきている。
sen.e: Meanwhile, the decreasing trend of bus passengers has become serious in recent years because of the substantial increase of private cars, minibikes and bicycles in kyoto City caused by the nation-wide trend of motorization as well as the diversification of public transport such as the opening of the Karasuma line of Kyoto Municipal Subway.

The decreasing trend of bus passengers has become a serious in recent years due to the significant increase in private cars, minibikes and bicycles in Kyoto City, as caused by the nationwide trend of motorization and the diversification of public transport such as the opening of the Karasuma Line of the Kyoto Municipal Subway.

The decreasing trend of bus passengers has become serious in recent years due to the significant increase in private cars, minibikes and bicycles in Kyoto City, as caused by the nationwide trend of motorization and the diversification of public transport such as the opening of the Karasuma Line of the Kyoto Municipal Subway in 1981.
sen.cmt: 文法を修正しました。1981 を追加しました。

sen.j: 加えて沿線人口の減少傾向と住民の高齢化など輸送需要の低下が進んできた中、1989年の京阪電鉄京阪鴨東線開業や1997年の地下鉄烏丸線の全通（北山駅 (京都府)～国際会館駅間延伸）、JR山陰本線（嵯峨野線）の新駅開業や鉄道の電化・部分複線化（更に現在、京都駅～園部駅間の完全複線化工事が進行中である）などで、通勤・通学客が所要時間の短縮や他の交通機関との接続等の利便性から電車利用へ移行する結果となり、旅客輸送人員は1975年（昭和50年）度をピークに年々減少の一途をたどっている。
sen.e: In addition to the above, such factors like the decrease of population along the routes, the aging of residents, the opening of the Keihan Oto Line of Keihan Electric Railway, full-opening of the Karasuma Line (Kitayama Station (Kyoto prefecture)～Kokusai Kaikan Station section was extended), the opening of a new station and the completion of electrification ・ partial double track of the JR Sanin Main Line (works for whole double track are currently underway between Kyoto Station and Sonobe Station) promoted the shift of passengers to electric trains because of reduced travelling time and the convenience of transfer to other public transport, and under such circumstances, the number of passengers of the company has been continuously decreasing since 1975 when it peaked.

In addition to the above, such factors as the decrease of population along the routes, the aging of residents, the opening of the Keihan Oto Line of the Keihan Electric Railway, the full opening of the Karasuma Line (by which the Kitayama Station (Kyoto Prefecture)～Kokusai Kaikan Station section was extended), the opening of a new station and the completion of electrification ・ partial double-tracking of the JR Sanin Main Line (the work required for full double-tracking is continuing between Kyoto Station and Sonobe Station) promoted the shift of passengers to electric trains because of the reduced travel time and the convenience of transfer to other means of public transportation, and under such circumstances the company's number of passengers has continued to decrease since its peak period of 1975.

In addition to the above, such factors as the decrease of population along the routes, the aging of residents, the opening of the Keihan Oto Line of the Keihan Electric Railway in 1989, the full opening of the Karasuma Line in 1997 (by which the Kitayama Station (Kyoto Prefecture) - Kokusaikaikan Station section was extended), the opening of a new station and the completion of electrification and partial double-tracking of the JR Sanin Main Line (Sagano Line) (the work required for full double-tracking is continuing between Kyoto Station and Sonobe Station) promoted the shift of passengers to electric trains because of the reduced travel time and the convenience of transfer to other means of public transportation, and under such circumstances the company's number of passengers has continued to decrease since its peak period of 1975.
sen.cmt: ～、・などをハイフン、andに変更しました。1989, 1997 を追加しました。

sen.j: この危機的な状況に対処する為に、1992年に路線の再編成（これは1997年の地下鉄烏丸線全通時にも京都市バスから左京区北部の路線の大半を移管するにあたっても行われている）や、輸送需要に応じて柔軟な車両変更（大型バスから中型バス、更にはマイクロバス化）やダイヤ改正を行いながら過疎地域路線を維持しつつ、1993年の京福電鉄（株）・京阪電鉄（株）支援による増資、「花背山の家」特定輸送の開始（1993年。この特定輸送の一部路線は宇治市内まで来ている）、「北山三角点トレック」ツアーの実施（1998年より）など、増収・事業の多角化を進めている。
sen.e: In order to cope with such critical situations, the company have strived for the sales increase and the diversification of business through various efforts such as the capital increase in 1993 by the support of Keihan Electric Railway, the launch of Hanase Yama-no-ie specific transport (1993. Some routes of this specific transport extends to Uji City) and the implementation of "Kitayama Sankakuten Trek" tour (since 1998) while maintaining the lines running depopulated area through the rationalization efforts such as the reshuffle of lines made in 1992 (such reshuffle was also made in 1997 when the Karasuma Line fully opened and the Kyoto City Bus's lines running in northern area of Sakyo Ward were transferred to the company), flexible change of cars depending on the transport demand (from large-sized buses to middle-sized buses and further to microbuses) and the revision of time schedule.

To cope with such a critical situation, the company has endeavored to increase sales and diversify its business through various means, such as the capital increase in 1993 with the support of Keihan Electric Railway, the launch of Hanase Yama-no-ie specific transport (1993; some routes of this specific transport extend to Uji City) and the implementation of "Kitayama Sankakuten Trek" tour (since 1998) while maintaining the lines running through depopulated areas via the rationalization efforts such as the reshuffling of lines in 1992 (such reshuffling was also done in 1997 when the Karasuma Line fully opened and the Kyoto City Bus lines running in the northern area of Sakyo Ward were transferred to the company), the flexible change of cars depending on the transport demand (from large buses to medium-size buses and further to microbuses) and the revision of the time schedule.

To cope with such a critical situation, the company has endeavored to increase sales and diversify its business through various means, such as the capital increase in 1993 with the support of Keifuku Electric Railroad and Keihan Electric Railway, the launch of 'Hanase Yama-no-ie' (an outdoor recreation center in Hanase which is run by Kyoto City) specific transport (1993; some routes of this specific transport extend to Uji City) and the implementation of 'Kitayama Sankakuten Trek' tour (since 1998) while maintaining the lines running through depopulated areas via the rationalization efforts such as the reshuffling of lines in 1992 (such reshuffling was also done in 1997 when the Karasuma Line fully opened and the Kyoto City Bus lines running in the northern area of Sakyo Ward were transferred to the company), the flexible change of cars depending on the transport demand (from large buses to medium-size buses and further to microbuses) and the revision of the time schedule.

On all four sides of its body, "KYOTO BUS," the company logo written in the Roman alphabet, and four stripes (red, blue, orange and yellow) are arranged, and the basic color of the seats inside the bus is dark blue imprinted with patterns similar to stripes on the body.

sen.j: 設備面では、正シート28席のうち後部2列は回転し、サロンとして使用できるほか、サブエンジン式フルオートエアコン、天井埋め込み式液晶モニターテレビ、シンセサイザーカラオケ、観光ガイド機能付きナビゲーションシステムなどが装備されている。
sen.e: As for equipments, it has 28 seats and those of 2 back rows are rotating seats which can be used as a salon, and it is also equipped with a sub-engine-type automated air-conditioner, a LCD monitor television embedded in the ceiling, a synthesizer karaoke and a car-navigation system with the function of sight-seeing guidance.

It's equipped with 28 seats (those of two back rows rotate for use as a salon), a sub-engine-type automated air-conditioner, an LCD monitor television embedded in the ceiling, a synthesizer karaoke system and a car-navigation system with a sightseeing guidance function.

It's equipped with 28 seats (those of two back rows rotate for use as a salon), a sub-engine-type automated air-conditioner, an LCD monitor television embedded in the ceiling, a synthesizer karaoke system and a car-navigation system with a sightseeing guidance function.

sen.j: 高野営業所では2年ぶりの新車となる大型車（10.5m）が「新7Eボディ」にて導入された。
sen.e: A large-sized bus (10.5m) using "New 7E Body" was introduced to Takano Office for the first time in 2 years.
A large bus (10.5 meters) using the "New 7E Body" was introduced to the Takano office for the first time in two years.
A large bus (10.5 m) using the 'New 7E Body' was introduced to the Takano office for the first time in two years.

sen.j: 富士重工製ボディは今回よりモデルチェンジを受け、外見上の主な変更点は、バンパー内フォグランプ位置変更、サイドフォグ新設、前面方向幕窓ガラスの1枚化、側面窓下モールの廃止などである。
sen.e: The principal changes in the appearance of Fuji Heavy Industries' body after its model changes are the change of the position of fog lamps in a bumper, the installation of side fog lamps, the adoption of a sheet of window glass for front direction curtain and the abolishment of moru situated under side window.
sen.cmt: モールの意味が分かりませんので、ローマ字表記にしております。
sen.e: The principal changes in the appearance of Fuji Heavy Industries' body after its model changes are the change in the positions of the bumper-mounted fog lamps, the installation of side fog lamps, the adoption of a sheet of window glass for the front direction curtain and the abolishment of the drain molding from beneath the side windows.

The principal changes in the appearance of Fuji Heavy Industries' body after its model changes are the change in the positions of the bumper-mounted fog lamps, the installation of side fog lamps, the adoption of a sheet of window glass for the front direction curtain and the abolishment of the drain molding from beneath the side windows.

sen.j: また、高野営業所では初めての車椅子対応車となった。
sen.e: This was the first bus at Takano office that could deal with wheelchairs.
This was the first bus at the Takano office that could handle wheelchairs.
This was the first bus at the Takano office that could handle wheelchairs.

sen.j: 「いすゞ・エルガLV」も10.5mとフルサイズにて導入され、一昨年導入された「エルガLT」全長9mとは一線を画している。
sen.e: "Isuzu ・ ERGA LV" was introduced as full-sized one, 10.5m in length, and it is different from "ERGA LT", 9m in length, that was introduced in the year before last.
"Isuzu ・ ERGA LV" was introduced as a full-size model, 10.5 meters in length, being different from "ERGA LT" (nine meters in length) that was introduced in the year before last.
Isuzu ERGA LV' was introduced as a full-size model, 10.5 meters in length, being different from 'ERGA LT' (nine meters in length) that was introduced in the year before last.

sen.j: 日産ディーゼル車と同じく車椅子対応となっている。
sen.e: Like the buses of Nissan Diesel Motor, this bus also could deal with wheelchairs.
Like the buses of Nissan Diesel Motor, this bus also could handle wheelchairs.
Like the buses of Nissan Diesel Motor, this bus also could handle wheelchairs.

sen.j: また昨年に続いてレインボーHRが2両導入されたが、高野営業所管轄の狭隘路線で使用されるため、全長7mサイズとなっている。
sen.e: Although 2 buses of Rainbow HR were introduced for 2 consecutive years, their length were 7m since they are used on the narrow roads inside the jurisdiction of Takano Office.

Although two buses of Rainbow HR were introduced in two consecutive years, they were seven meters in length since they were to be used on the narrow roads within the jurisdiction of the Takano office.

Although two buses of Rainbow HR were introduced in two consecutive years, they were seven meters in length since they were to be used on the narrow roads within the jurisdiction of the Takano office.

sen.j: 2003年度は昨年度に引き続きUAワンステップが導入されたが、上記にもある通り、富士重工がバス車体製造を終了したため、1974年3月廃車分から実に30年ぶりの西日本車体工業製のボディが導入された。
sen.e: In 2003, UA one-step buses were introduced for 2 consecutive years and they used the bodies manufactured by Nishinippon Shatai Kogyo for the first time in 30 years since the last bus had been discarded in 1974 because, as mentioned above, Fuji Heavy Industries had ceased to manufacture bus bodies.

In 2003, UA one-step buses were introduced for two consecutive years, using bodies manufactured by Nishinippon Shatai Kogyo for the first time in 30 years since the last bus was discarded in 1974 because, as mentioned above, Fuji Heavy Industries had ceased the manufacture of bus bodies.

In fiscal year 2003, UA one-step buses were introduced for two consecutive years, using bodies manufactured by Nishinippon Shatai Kogyo for the first time in 30 years since the last bus was discarded in March 1974 because, as mentioned above, Fuji Heavy Industries had ceased the manufacture of bus bodies.
sen.cmt: fiscal year を追加しました。3月 を追加しました。

sen.j: またブルーリボンシティ・ワンステップとエルガLVもそれぞれ2台と1台導入されている。
sen.e: Further, 2 Blue Ribbon City・One-step and an ERGA were also introduced.
Additionally, two Blue Ribbon City・One-step and an ERGA were introduced.
Additionally, two Blue Ribbon City one-step and an ERGA LV were introduced.
sen.cmt: ・→カンマ に変更しました。LVを追加しました。

sen.j: 2004年度はブルーリボンシティ・ワンステップとエルガLVがそれぞれ7台と3台導入され、昨年導入されたタイプとほぼ同じ仕様となっているが、京都バスで初めてLED式行先表示器を装備し近代化を図ったほか、マーカーランプの廃止や降車合図ボタンの変更、車内握り棒のデザイン変更などが施されている。
sen.e: In 2004, 7 Blue Ribbon City・One-step and 3 ERGA were introduced and although their specs were basically same with those of previous year's model, they were equipped with LED destination display for modernization purpose and some improvements were made such as the abolishment of marker lamps, the change of buttons for requesting a stop and the change in the design of poles for gripping.

In 2004, seven Blue Ribbon City・One-step and three ERGA vehicles were introduced, and although their specs were basically same as those of the previous year's model, they were equipped with LED destination displays for the sake of modernization and certain others improvements were made, such as the abolishment of marker lamps, the change of buttons for requesting a stop and the change in the design of passenger hand-poles.

In fiscal year 2004, seven Blue Ribbon City one-step and three ERGA LV vehicles were introduced, and although their specs were basically same as those of the previous year's model, they were equipped with LED destination displays for the sake of modernization and certain other improvements were made, such as the abolishment of marker lamps, the change of buttons for requesting a stop and the change in the design of passenger hand-poles.
sen.cmt: fiscal year を追加しました。LVを追加しました。

sen.j: また京都バスでは初めてとなる大型フルサイズ（12m）ハイデッカー観光バスセレガR-FDが導入され、ボディデザインは2002年導入の中型サロンカーを踏襲しているが、定員は60席（補助席込み）となり、前後2ヶ所の液晶モニターテレビ、シンセサイザーカラオケなどの装備を備えている。
sen.e: A large full-sized (12m) high-deck sightseeing bus, S'elega R-FD, was introduced for the first time for Kyoto Bus and although its body design inherited that of middle-sized salon-car introduced in 2002, it had 60 seats (including spare seats) and was equipped with 2 LCD monitor TVs at the front and back of the bus as well as synthesizer karaoke.

A full-size (12m) high-deck sightseeing bus, the S'elega R-FD, was introduced for the first time for Kyoto Bus, and although its body design inherited that of medium-size salon car introduced in 2002, it had 60 seats (including spare seats) and was equipped with two LCD monitor TVs (at the front and back of the bus) as well as synthesizer karaoke.

A full-size (12m) high-deck sightseeing bus, the S'elega R-FD, was introduced for the first time for Kyoto Bus, and although its body design inherited that of medium-size salon car introduced in 2002, it had 60 seats (including spare seats) and was equipped with two LCD monitor TVs (at the front and back of the bus) as well as synthesizer karaoke.

sen.j: さらに日野メルファ7も2台導入され、うち1台は山間部のメロディーバス用のマイクを備えている。
sen.e: Further, 2 Hino Melpha were introduced and one of them was equipped with a microphone for a melody bus running in mountain areas.
Moreover, two Hino Melpha vehicles were introduced, and one of them was equipped with a microphone for use as a melody bus running in mountain areas.
Moreover, two Hino Melpha vehicles were introduced, and one of them was equipped with a microphone for use as a melody bus running in mountain areas.

sen.j: 2005年度も例年通りブルーリボンシティ・ワンステップとエルガLVがそれぞれ1台と2台導入されたほか、2003年度に引き続きUAワンステップが西日本車体工業製のボディにて3台導入された。
sen.e: In 2005, a Blue Ribbon City・One-step and 2 ERGA were introduced as usual and besides them, 3 UA One-step using the body manufactured by Nishinippon Shatai Kogyo were introduced after an interval of a year since 2003.

In 2005, a Blue Ribbon City・One-step and two ERGA vehicles were introduced as usual, and additionally three UA One-step models using bodies manufactured by Nishinippon Shatai Kogyo were introduced at one-year intervals since 2003.

In fiscal year 2005, a Blue Ribbon City one-step and two ERGA LV vehicles were introduced as usual, and additionally three UA one-step models using bodies manufactured by Nishinippon Shatai Kogyo were introduced at one-year intervals since fiscal 2003.
sen.cmt: fiscal year を追加しました。Blue Ribbon City one-step としました。LVを追加しました。

sen.j: 2005年度の新車からシートが新デザイン（京阪バスと共通のもの）に変更となった。
sen.e: New seat design (common with that of Keihan Bus) was adopted for buses introduced in 2005.
A new seat design (shared with that of Keihan Bus) was adopted for the buses introduced in 2005.
A new seat design (shared with that of Keihan Bus) was adopted for the buses introduced in fiscal year 2005.
sen.cmt: fiscal year を追加しました。

sen.j: 2006年度は、高野営業所は例年通りエルガLVが5台導入されたが、従来より日野自動車製バスを配置してきた嵐山営業所は日野自動車の車種統廃合のため、いすゞ自動車のOEMにて「日野ブルーリボンII」が6台導入された。
sen.e: In 2006, while Takano Office introduced 5 ERGA LV as usual, Arashiyama office, which had used buses manufactured by Hino Motors Ltd. until then, introduced 6 "Hino Blue ribbon Ⅱ" which were manufactured by Isuzu Motors, Ltd. on OEM basis because Hino Motors had consolidated and eliminated the number of its car line.

In 2006, while the Takano office introduced five ERGA LVs as usual, the Arashiyama office, which had until then used buses manufactured by Hino Motors, Ltd., introduced six "Hino Blue Ribbon Ⅱ" vehicles, which were manufactured by Isuzu Motors, Ltd., on an OEM basis because Hino Motors had consolidated and eliminated the number of its car line.

In fiscal year 2006, while the Takano office introduced five ERGA LVs as usual, the Arashiyama office, which had until then used buses manufactured by Hino Motors, Ltd., introduced six 'Hino Blue Ribbon Ⅱ' vehicles, which were manufactured by Isuzu Motors, Ltd., on an OEM basis because Hino Motors had consolidated and eliminated the number of its car line.
sen.cmt: fiscal year を追加しました。"→ ' としました。

sen.j: また2006年導入車より新短期排気ガス規制車となり、エンジンが排気ガス規制に対応している。
sen.e: Buses that were introduced in 2006 were subject to the revised short-time emission control standard and their engines conformed to such standard.
The buses introduced in 2006 were subject to the revised short-time emission control standard, to which their engines complied.
The buses introduced in fiscal 2006 were subject to the revised short-time emission control standard, to which their engines complied.

sen.j: 高野営業所には2006年3月現在67両の車両が配置されている。
sen.e: As of March 2006, 67 buses are allocated at Takano Office.
As of March 2006, 67 buses are allocated at the Takano office.
As of March 2006, 67 buses are allocated at the Takano office.

sen.j: 大型車が45両（日産ディーゼル33両・いすゞ12両）、中型車が11両（いすゞ大型短尺7両・日野HR9m2両 HR7m2両）、マイクロバスが11両（日野）で、このうちマイクロバス5両が貸切・路線兼用車である。
sen.e: The breakdown of the above is 45 Large-sized buses (33 buses of Nissan Diesel Motor・12 buses of Isuzu Motor), 11 middle-sized buses (7 semi-large-sized buses of Isuzu・2 Hino HR9m・2 Hino HR7m) and 11 microbuses (Hino) and among them, 5 microbuses are used both for route bus service and reserved bus service.

The breakdown of the above is 45 large buses (33 buses of Nissan Diesel Motor・12 buses of Isuzu Motor), 11 medium-size buses (7 semi-large buses of Isuzu・2 Hino HR9m・2 Hino HR7m) and 11 microbuses (Hino), and among them, five microbuses are used for both route bus service and reserve bus service.

The breakdown of the above is 45 large buses (33 buses of Nissan Diesel Motor and 12 buses of Isuzu Motors), 11 medium-size buses (7 semi-large buses of Isuzu, 2 Hino HR9m and 2 Hino HR7m) and 11 microbuses (Hino), and among them, five microbuses are used for both route bus service and reserve bus service.
sen.cmt: ・をカンマおよびand に変更しました。

sen.j: 高野営業所の路線は朽木村・雲ヶ畑・花背など北山の山間部の路線もあり、中型車は19系統と32系統などに、マイクロ車は33系統や37系統、27・29・46系統などで使用されている。
sen.e: As some buses under the jurisdiction of Takano Office run in Kitayama mountain area such as Kutsuki-mura, Kumogahata and Hanase, middle-sized buses are used for route 19 and route 32 and microbuses are used for route 33, route 37 as well as route 27・29・46 etc.

As some buses under the jurisdiction of the Takano office run in the Kitayama mountain area, such as Kutsuki-mura, Kumogahata and Hanase, medium-size buses are used for routes 19 and 32 while microbuses are used for routes 33 and 37 as well as route 27・29・46, etc.

As some buses under the jurisdiction of the Takano office run in the Kitayama mountain area, such as Kutsuki-mura, Kumogahata and Hanase, medium-size buses are used for routes 19 and 32 while microbuses are used for routes 33 and 37 as well as route 27, 29, 46, etc.
sen.cmt: ・をカンマおよびand に変更しました。

sen.j: 1999年以降の車両はワンステップバスが導入されている。
sen.e: One-step buses have been introduced since 1999.
One-step buses have been in use since 1999.
One-step buses have been in use since 1999.

sen.j: 嵐山営業所には、2006年3月現在67両の車両が配置されている。
sen.e: As of March 2006, 67 buses are allocated at Arashiyama Office.
As of March 2006, 67 buses are allocated at the Arashiyama office.

sen.j: 所属車両は大型路線車が48両（日野47両、日産ディーゼル1両）、特定（花背山の家）の中型車（大型の9.5m尺）が7両（いすゞ）、貸切がセレガR（9.5m車）1両、セレガR（FD）1両、日産ディーゼル大型車3両、マイクロバスが2両（日野）、京都産業大学シャトルバス専用車が日野2両、三菱車1両、教習車が日野、日産ディーゼル大型車、各1両ずつである。
sen.e: The breakdown of the above is 48 large-sized buses for route bus service (47 buses of Hino Motor, 1 bus of Nissan Diesel), 7 middle-sized buses (9.5m version of large-sized bus) (Isuzu) for specific use (Hanase Yama-no-ie), 1 S'elega R (FD), 3 large-sized buses of Nissan Diesel, 2 microbuses (Hino), 2 buses of Hino and 1 bus of Mitsubishi for exclusive use of shuttle bus service for Kyoto Sangyo University and 2 large-sized buses of Hino and Nissan Diesel for exclusive use of training.

The breakdown of the above is 48 large buses for route bus service (47 buses of Hino Motor, one bus of Nissan Diesel), seven medium-size buses (the 9.5m version of a large bus) (Isuzu) for specific use (Hanase Yama-no-ie), one S'elega R (FD), three large buses of Nissan Diesel, two microbuses (Hino), two buses of Hino and one bus of Mitsubishi for exclusive use in shuttle bus service for Kyoto Sangyo University, and two large buses of Hino and Nissan Diesel for exclusive use in training.

sen.cmt: two large buses →one large bus of Hino and another large bus of Nissan Diesel としました。

sen.j: 京都バスは1996年からマイクロバスで貸切バス事業を開始した。
sen.e: From 1996, Kyoto Bus commenced reserved bus business using microbuses.
In 1996, Kyoto Bus commenced its reserve bus business using microbuses.

sen.j: 1996年式は2両が貸切専用車、3両が貸切・路線兼用車である。
sen.e: In 1996, 2 buses were exclusive for reserved bus service and 3 buses were used for both reserved bus service and route bus service.
In 1996, two buses were dedicated exclusively to reserve bus service, while three buses were used for both reserve bus service and route bus service.
In 1996, two buses were dedicated exclusively to reserve bus service, while three buses were used for both reserve bus service and route bus service.

sen.j: その後、2000年には1984年式の路線・特定兼用車だった大型車3両が貸切登録となった。
sen.e: Thereafter in 2000, 3 large-sized buses of 1984 model which had been used for both services were registered as the ones for exclusive use of reserved bus service.
Subsequently, in 2000 three large buses of the 1984 model, which had been used for both services, were registered for the exclusive use of reserved bus service.
Subsequently, in 2000 three large buses of the 1984 model, which had been used for both services, were registered for the exclusive use of reserved bus service.

sen.j: これ以外にも、京都産業大学シャトルバスが貸切輸送で運行されている他、一般路線車が路線貸切に充当されるケースがある。
sen.e: Other than the above, shuttle bus service for Kyoto Sangyo University is being operated on reserved service basis and from time to time, buses for route bus service are used for route reserved bus service.
